biosample.biomaterialProvider: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History, Washington D.C.

description.comment: The Great Potoo (Nyctibius grandis) is the largest bird of the Caprimulgiformes order. It is nocturnal, like owls, and has characteristics of owls. They inhabit tropical America from Mexico to Southern Brazil, and make moaning growl sounds throughout the night that gives some of the tropics it nights sound scape. This sample was collected from a female caught in Guyana by B.J. O'Shea, stored at the Smithsonian collection in Washington D.C., and procured by curator Gary Graves to generate a chromosome level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP and B10K Projects. The same sample was also used for the B10K family-level draft genome assembly labelled B10K-DU-001-56.
description.title: Animal sample from Nyctibius grandis

biosample.geoLocName: Guyana: St. Cuthbert's Mission Road, Linden Highway

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Great potoo sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the principal haplotype of the diploid genome Nyctibius grandis and includes the chromosomes. The alternate haplotype sequences are in WGS project JABXNW000000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
